alert.note: Alert for Knox (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:02PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Knox County through 1130 PM EDT... At 1102 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to near Gambier to near Utica. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Gambier, Utica, Danville, Martinsburg, Gann and Bladensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
